1.title: Undiscovered Country
1.plot: On her way to her "Hamlet" stage audition (in a 25-minute one-take episode that hits five different locations), Gus brings up the relationship issues he's having with Michelle as they settle into married life. Just when the couple thinks they're back on track, one incident causes a near accident and sends them on a different route.

2.title: Stool Pigeon
2.plot: Michelle Macabee meets a "fan" while she's on a walk at the beach, but her "fan" turns out to be someone she knows who spills the beans about Gus. Michelle walks away and is chased and harassed by this young woman until Michael Miller, a passerby, breaks up the argument and befriends Michelle.

3.title: Wed-Lock
3.plot: Michelle challenges Gus in couple's therapy, with their new couple's therapist, Dr. Kerr. Gus claims he knows nothing about the "rumors" Michelle has heard, and by the end of their session, he diverts the attention off of him and makes Michelle an offer she cannot resist.

4.title: Carmel by the sea
4.plot: After their adoption class, Michelle and Gus, while walking along the bike path next to the Expo train late at night, have a heart-to-heart discussion about the direction their relationship is taking.

5.title: Bromo-DragonFLY
5.plot: In a 25-minute one-take, we follow Gus on his way to his drug supplier. While he makes his way through the shady side of downtown at two in the morning, we hear his thoughts (in Spanish with English subtitles) as he struggles with everything he's going through at this particular juncture in his life.

6.title: The Department of Justice
6.plot: In a fourth interview with Mrs. Shannon Pierce, a foster-to-adopt social worker, Gus, with Michelle by his side, is drilled with personal questions that make him so uncomfortable he threatens to file a complaint to Mrs. Pierce's supervisor, but when Mrs. Pierce reveals what she knows about Gus, Michelle freezes in a state of disbelief.

7.title: Topography of Mind
7.plot: Gus shows up at the home of a new client who uses their meeting as an opportunity to teach him a very painful life lesson.

8.title: Coffee and Rum
8.plot: Michelle stops by the home of Michael Miller, the gentleman she met in episode two. One thing leads to another that causes Michelle to leave, but before she does, she reveals something to Michael that brings the two together in the most unforeseeable way.

1.title: El Sol
1.plot: In the Season One premiere, Michelle Macabee waits for the Expo Train in Los Angeles late at night and unexpectedly meets Gus.

2.plot: Three months later. Michelle drives down Venice Boulevard with Gus and after he reveals one secret after another, the direction of their bumpy conversation takes many swerves.

3.title: Therapy
3.plot: Marion, Michelle's pet loss therapist, gets Michelle to accept that she's in the midst of a mid-life crisis after her dog of fifteen years died and she convinces Michelle that she should take full advantage of Gus...but only sexually.

4.title: Midnight at McDonald's
4.plot: In Spanish with English subtitles. An aside with Gus as he devours his burger and fries at McDonald's and talks to himself about the roller coaster ride he's on following his break-up with Michelle.

5.title: Mid-Life
5.plot: Michelle's best friend, Nicole, gets a thorough lesson on menopause. Nicole admits to relapsing with her addiction problem and tells Michelle that if she doesn't use Gus for sex, she will.

6.title: One-Night Stand
6.plot: Gus meets Michelle at a park after Michelle contacted him. Michelle confesses that she still wants to spend time with Gus, and Gus tells Michelle that he wants to live with her. He gives her one week to think about it.

7.title: Online Dating
7.plot: Over cocktails, Nicole and Alex, another friend of Michelle's from Amazon, turn Michelle onto a hot stud from an online cougar dating site, but Michelle's affection for Gus gets in the way.

8.title: Twenty-Three
8.plot: In Twenty-Three, an aside with Alex and Nicole, the two get high and talk about what they really think of Michelle.

9.title: Lost in the L Word
9.plot: In Spanish with English subtitles. An aside with Gus. As he rides the Ferris wheel on a cloudy day at the Santa Monica pier, we hear his thoughts while he figures out why he hasn't heard from Michelle.

10.title: The Martini Date
10.plot: Michelle musters up the courage to meet the cub from the online cougar dating site for drinks, but she finds out that he's nothing at all like his profile.

11.title: In Bed
11.plot: After a night of great sex at a fancy hotel in downtown Los Angeles, Gus brings up living together which launches them into a deep conversation about their age differences, their love for one another, and the tough decisions they must make.

12.title: Coke & M&M's
12.plot: Mark and Bob work for Amazon, the company Michelle worked at for a decade. Meeting in their usual place, the parking garage at headquarters, Bob tells Mark that Alex invited him over for brunch in order to set him up with Michelle.

13.title: Brunch
13.plot: Following a line of coke, Joel, Alex's partner, tells Alex that his straight squash buddy, Bob, is at the door while he continues to wait for Alex to join he, Michelle, and Gus in the dining room for brunch. Alex tells Bob that Michelle, his "blind date," showed up with her kid boyfriend, Gus, but Bob decides to stay anyway.

14.title: After Hours
14.plot: Following "Brunch," we go on a journey with Michelle, Gus, Alex, Joel, and Bob as each of them dives into their own late-night worlds following an uncomfortable afternoon together.

1.title: Red Flags
1.plot: While Michelle drives and listens to a radio show about the mid-life/menopausal experience, she gets a text message from Gus asking her to meet him at their downtown spot since he's on break from work. No sooner than she says yes, he pops the question. Once Michelle meets Gus, he pops yet another question which changes everything for both of them.

2.title: Compton Girl
2.plot: Gus leaves he and Michelle's neighborhood in the City of Angels, bike-to-bus and then bike to a nearby neighborhood, to meet Sonya, his older sister. Sonya complains about her minimum wage jobs, asks Gus if he's living with an "older lady friend," and then gets around to the real reason why she needs to talk to Gus. When Gus realizes what Sonya wants from him, he has more than a few things to say about it which changes their relationship forever.

3.title: Truth and Lies
3.plot: In couple's therapy, Michelle challenges Gus for withholding his shady past causing Gus to storm out of the room. Alone with the therapist, Michelle reveals that Gus' secrets have stymied her love for him, but when Gus returns, the therapist gives the lovers insights that move them away from old ideas about their pasts, replacing them with new ones in their present.

4.title: The Movie Star
4.plot: Michelle joins a new pet loss therapy group, and to her surprise meets famous British movie star, Seth Parker; the only one in the group who deeply identifies with Michelle's share. Following the meeting, Seth invites Michelle for a car ride and discovers something unique about Michelle which convinces him she should follow a certain specific career path. Later, after Gus learns that Michelle hung out with Mr. Parker all afternoon and that his favorite movie star is now steering the direction of her career, Gus steers Michelle's attention back to their relationship ...

5.title: Narcotics Anonymous
5.plot: Alex, Michelle's friend from Amazon, meets millennial, Peter, following a narcotics anonymous meeting. Peter helps Alex cope with his withdrawal symptoms, and then not before long, Alex and Peter are so besotted with one another that they find themselves acting impulsively. Alex, however, snaps back to reality and remains faithful to his husband and his number one priority, his sobriety.

6.title: Mexican Brown
6.plot: Gus meets "his employer," Jeremy, at one of their usual locations. Jeremy asks Gus why his sister Sonya would call him and say that Gus stopped working for him. Gus assures Jeremy he still works for him, but for different reasons now.

7.title: First Step
7.plot: Alex catches up with his friend Michelle and then following protocol of his twelve-step program, makes amends to she and Gus for insulting their relationship in Season One. Michelle accepts his apology, but when Gus does not, Alex's emotions rise to the surface. Peter, now Alex's sponsor, comes onto the scene, and sensing the tension, tries to lighten the mood, but fails so miserably that Michelle and Gus leave. Alone, Peter and Alex step into their sponsor/sponsee roles until Peter reveals something personal about his life that changes everything.

8.title: Black Tar
8.plot: Michelle and Gus drink whiskey with Steve and Chelsea, Michelle's brother and his wife, until the evening turns Virginia Woolf like. Steve attacks Michelle for her new-found career and Gus for his newly realized ambitions, however it's Gus' announcement that throws everyone for a loop and ends Season Two with us guessing...what's next?

-1.title: Midnight at McDonald's
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: In this 5X Emmy-nominated, 8X Indie Series Awards-nominated one-shot series, when Michelle Macabee meets the sexy and much younger Hispanic - Gus Borrero - they have an unexpected connection they discover is worth fighting for, despite the challenges of their age difference, their pasts, and the strong opinions of friends, family, and everyone they have conversations with in the City of Angels.
imdb.title: Conversations in L.A.
plot: In this 5X Emmy-nominated, 8X Indie Series _Awards_ (qv)-nominated one-shot series, when Michelle Macabee meets the sexy and much younger Hispanic - Gus Borrero - they have an unexpected connection they discover is worth fighting for, despite the challenges of their age difference, their pasts, and the strong opinions of friends, family, and everyone they have conversations with in the City of Angels.::Anne Marie Cummings
